website_summaries.verdict: An affordable cup duo by a top name in baby items. Despite a few concerns, they are easy to hold, durable, and priced for those on a budget.
pros: Guaranteed by the company to be leak- and spill-proof
cons: Some kids have difficulty getting a steady stream of liquid
Wide bottoms won't fit all cup holders

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second set!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the "Girl" colors. I liked them so much I bought a second set. I bought "assorted colors" the second time and received Pink and purple both times. They work perfectly without ANY leaks. I read that other people have leak problems and I'm wondering if they knew to use the removable spill-proof seal. I love the shape, it makes it really easy to hold and harder to drop. I personally use these sippies as a calming technique at night for my PTSD and insomnia. I prefer these without the leak-proof seal because it works TOO well. It's hard to get alot of liquid at once, which I'm sure is great for kids and small children.
customer_reviews.author: xxSmiley

customer_reviews.title: Quality has changed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before and LOVED them. Then I purchased again and something must have changed because the quality has gone way down. They leak even when I have the arrows lined up and the white insert inside. I'm really disappointed because they used to be great.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Hidden Spots for Mold to Grow
customer_reviews.text: The cup itself is great. Our son has transitioned flawlessly from bottles to these cups. Unfortunately, there are spots that will grow mold if left uncleaned and it’s nearly impossible to get to these spots once they’re affected. The spots are within the filter, right around the ring of plastic that alllows flow when sucked. Other spots are in the inside of the nozzle, right around the opening to the nozzle. Also, there are pockets around the cylinder where the filter pops in that will grow mold if not cleaned immediately. If you’re diligent on cleaning dishes, these are great. If you let dishes sit for a period of time, you’ll be throwing out moldy tops and filters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, Beware of Dishwasher Accident
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these cups for over a month and I've had no troubles, except for the dishwasher. One lid fell through to the bottom where the heating wire is and it melted. That was my fault since it wasn't secure enough. I now put it in the basket to avoid it being knocked onto the bottom again. I haven't had issues with leaks and this is extremely easy to clean. Putting it back together is just as easy! I'm so glad I found these!
customer_reviews.author: A. Lohrum

customer_reviews.title: Leak issues with some color combinations.
customer_reviews.text: Leak issues with some color combinations. While I ordered at least 10 of these bottles in the past and they never leaked, the most recent pair was leaking badly. Amazon sent replacement right away but the new bottles were leaking as well. They seem to have a production issue as it's only affecting one color combination of bottles. Update 02-20-2018 It appears that only the color combination sold for $4.47 as add-on item is leaking. After I ordered another set for $7.87, I noticed that those do not leak. Only the ones's currently available for $4.47 are leaking
customer_reviews.author: Soennichsen, T.

customer_reviews.title: Better out there
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my 2 year old. The price was very fair for getting the 4 pack I chose. Maybe these will be better for me down the road but they are hard to pull the liquid they, my daughter is unable to do so, I tried myself and found difficulty in doing so. One of the lids leaks.
customer_reviews.author: James Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: 2 of our 3 kids used these after bottles. The plastic tops hold up to chewing and they tend not to leak a lot. Eventually we would remove the small diaphragm inside them when the kids got older. Our daughter doesn’t like them. Of the 2-3 sippy cup styles we have tried, these are probably her least favorite. I’m not knocking stars for that. These are fairly easy to clean with ONE caveat. You must clean the inside piece fairly quickly. If they sit for a day or so with chocolate milk or something in them it tends to permanently stain and wear out the little seal.
customer_reviews.author: Itsme

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars!
customer_reviews.text: 10 stars! I have been searching and searching and searching for a toddler cup that can be tipped upside down, shaken, bit, and still not leak! FOUND it! These bottles have a hard plastic so the child can not bite it and create holes that make it leak when turned upside down. This is a little bit bigger of a cup than most of the other ones we tried but I seriously love it! It has been a great cup and my toddler seems to like it too because he seems to drink a lot more with this than the other cups we have had.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Kendoll

customer_reviews.title: Not leakproof but better
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2 pack assorted colors for my son who is 1.5 and notorious for spilling cups and leaking all over the house. Unfortunately I recieved a pink and purple set of cups. But since I didn't pick colors ok.it's ok. The size is easy for his small hands to grasp. I like the double layer of leak protection. Unfortunately in less than twenty minutes my son had shaken it enough to get a few drops out on the table so I cant call it leak proof. But it was way less spill than our other cups so I liked it
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Out of all the sippy cups these are my favorite, and I have bough several
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the sippy cups these are my favorite, and I have bough several. They only have one small piece for the lid that easily comes in and out. They do not leak and they do not wear out. I highly recommend over others with several pieces or hard to clean areas. The only con is they are slightly large for cup holders, but since they do not leak it doesn't really matter where they go!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Loved them, now nervous
customer_reviews.text: These were working great for my son but now I’ve noticed some terrible areas that are impossible to clean! Inside the cap, the underside of where the mouthpiece is, there is a section that seems to collect drink product that can’t be reached with towels or sponges. Now I’m afraid of mold growth! I’ll talk it over with my wife, but we may be getting rid of these cups if we cannot figure out a way to clean them. I do not recommend these cups! NUK, help!
customer_reviews.author: Sween

customer_reviews.title: Bottle color seeps into the water
customer_reviews.text: We left water sitting in the red sippy cup overnight, and when we went to dump it out the next morning the water was dyed red. These cups had been through the dishwasher MANY times, we have had been using them for months. It’s terrifying to think our son has potentially been injesting artificial coloring from plastic, please do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Norm

customer_reviews.title: Finally a leakproof cup!
customer_reviews.text: The cups are solid, leakproof and easy to clean. However getting the lids off at first was a major pain in the butt. I don’t know if it was a fluke with the two pack I got or just a brand issue, but after a day or so of using and washing the lids come off easily enough now. My three year old loves them and even my nine year old enjoys a sippy cup from time to time. A great deal!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Invincible. Leak proof. So practical. So easy.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using these cups since 2012. The only cups we replace are the cups we’ve lost.... or lost under the couch with milk and discovered a few days too late. Ew. Trash. Anyways- these cups are invincible! And 100% leak proof!! I have never had any issues with the white valve coming loose over time. I always wash the white valve in the silverware holder of the dishwasher. And the kids and cups do fine on the top or bottom shelf. This may be the most practical product on my mommy list....
customer_reviews.author: TAP

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good sippy cup!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how many different design options there are for toddler sippy cups. It's so easy to buy some with design flaws - I have a cabinet full of rejects. These are great! They are easy to clean, seriously SPILL PROOF, and easy for my toddler to hold. The only complaint it that the bottom is a little too wide to fit into my toddler's cup holder on his car seat (I don't car, but he sure does!) So I wish it was a little more narrow at the wider points, but when it comes to the number of spills I am finally able to prevent, I'll take the shape they are!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Berezin

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product info.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 1 year old son. They sent girl colors. The first picture shows a blue & red one, and the description says assorted colors. After reading a previous review, I saw that the customer also received girl colors for her son. Also, the spout is too hard. This sippy cup did not work for my son. I don't think this is a good transition from the bottle to a sippy cup due to the hard spout. I was hoping to like this sippy cup. I will purchase others until I find the right one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Neesie24

customer_reviews.title: Glad it wasn’t going to be a gift
customer_reviews.text: Theses are just fine as far as the cups go. Nice set of sippy cups. I figure I couldn’t go wrong with Gerber brand but I dropped a star because of the packaging. The edges were coming unsealed, it was scuffed. Basically, it looked like it had been in a bargain bin. I would not feel good about gifting a package that looked like that but it was for my own use so it was ok. Packaging matters.
customer_reviews.author: GardenGal44

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean,  doesn't leak/ spill!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a sippy cup for my 18 month old that was easy to clean (using it for milk/ juice), durable and didn't require a super hard suck to get the liquid out. These were super cheap and definitely fit the bill. Only one small piece to clean carefully which is the valve to prevent spills/ leaking which it does a good job of. The only downside is the base is very wide so it won't fit in a standard cup holder on the high chair or stroller, but not a big deal for me. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brad G.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously the best
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the best!!!! I’ve tried so many cups with my 18mo old. He throws them on the ground and water or milk explode out of all others including the 360 cups. These were recommended by a friend. My son tries to get milk and water out of them as hard as he can. Only thing that ever comes out when they are really thrown hard is maybe a few drops. MAYBE. Nothing when it’s shaken upside down either. They seem easy enough to hold and very durable. I throw all in the dishwasher just take them apart. We LOVE THESE CUPS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura O.

customer_reviews.title: Works well in general but has a faulty design
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for us when we were encouraging our daughter to stop using the bottle, she was very interested in using these. They are also easy to clean. My biggest issue with these is that there is always liquid remaining in it (about 1/2 oz) because of its design. I hate throwing the remaining milk away. Our solution is that after she is done, we open the lid and let her finish the remaining milk by using it like a regular cup, which defies the whole purpose of it.
customer_reviews.author: pinar

customer_reviews.title: Truly no-leak
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I only bought two so I could try it out for my 1 year old. The last "no spill" sippy I got definitely leaked, so I was skeptical. But this product is fantastic and doesn't leak at all! My little one likes to play with his sippy cups and bang them on the floor. This one holds up to his destruction! No leaks at all. They are also easy for him to hold and colors are fun!
customer_reviews.author: TheMushroomMan

customer_reviews.title: Cloudy and lids look faded
customer_reviews.text: Colors really dont match the picture. The cups are cloudy and are not completely "clear". The lids are off colored as well. Kinda upset because I bought them for the pretty colors . They work just like all the nuk sippy cups. No leaks. Edit : the "boy" blue colors are way prettier. And actually match . Go online to other sellers for better picture representation.
customer_reviews.author: Alyhan

customer_reviews.title: I would NOT buy these again.
customer_reviews.text: Initially I loved these cups. My daughter loved using them, they didn't leak even the tiniest bit, but they are nearly impossible to clean. I would put milk in these cups, but after a few uses they started to mold in the lid. The lid has an extremely tiny space on either side of the spout on the inside that even a bottle brush can't get clean. I even tried throwing them in the dishwasher, but that didn't help. I threw these away and only got to use them for about 2 months. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Withstand a constant abuse and lasts FOREVOR.
customer_reviews.text: The first set lasted 5 years before the valve started leaking. Considered getting new valves, but they’re so inexpensive, just got a new set. This is the only sippy cup you will ever need. They’ve been tossed out a car window, dropped hundreds of times, they are scuffed but keep on going. The only time it’s leaked (before the valve gave out) was when it was thrown against something with enough force to dislodge the valve from the drink hole. It takes a lot. You just pop it back in and your back In business. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: AJParrack

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking after a year
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler really likes these for milk before nap time and bedtime, and for a year they worked great for that, as she drinks her milk in bed. Then, a few weeks ago, these bottles started to leak from the rim, letting the milk run down the sides. The grippy ridges catch the milk, but also make it difficult to quickly wipe clean. We are somewhat mystified as the lid and bottletop seem well-designed to prevent leaking, and we are careful to screw the lid on extremely tightly before handing the bottle over. Perhaps our dishwasher has worn these out? It’s too bad as these have been very durable and trouble-free, until now.
customer_reviews.author: EDouble

customer_reviews.title: Great cups!
customer_reviews.text: These are my absolute favorite hard spout sippys! I’ve used them for all thread of my boys and my oldest is 11. They are great cups and easy for little hands to hold. They take a beating and keep going. They do leak a tiny bit but that’s pretty much just the little of liquid that is in the lid in between sips. Only downfall is you have to replace the little piece that goes inside the lid and they are not the easiest to find at the stores or online.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is about 15 months, so she's a bit too young to drink from an open cup, but too old for a bottle. This sippy cup is perfect for her. The hourglass shape helps her get a good grasp on the bottle while being able to drink from it. It comes with an anti-leak tab on the inside, however you'd have to suck really hard to get any milk out. Unless we take the sippy cups out of the house, I don't keep the white tabs in as it can get frustrating for her.
customer_reviews.author: JCheng

customer_reviews.title: THEY NEVER LEAK!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two sets of these...the 10 ounce and the 7 ounce...that I purchased from Amazon years ago. I still love them! THEY NEVER LEAK. EVER. I can throw one in my purse and not think twice. If the kids need water at bedtime this is what I give them (they don't have to worry about closing the top of an insulated thermos in the middle of the night). Some reviewers may say that it's tough to suck the liquid out, but the kids figure it out. They are easy to hold and easy to clean. Not insulated, but they're so great I don't really care. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: bibliophile42

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second set!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for the perfect sippy cup for my 1 year old. I am so glad that I have found this. It's easy to clean, NO LEAK! which is a big relief for me. My son can hold it very well because of the shape of the cup. I have been getting the pink and purple one, theres no other option to pick a color meant for boys but its ok. As long as my son loves it and mommy loves it, im ok with it . Overall, i am extremely satisfied with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Ann

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SIPPY CUPS
customer_reviews.text: I love these cups for my kids. As long as you put the stopper they are leak proof. My kids purposely try to make their cups leak by tipping them over and shaking the bottle hard. Luckily with these I dont have to clean up their experiments. My one year old and 2 year old like drinking from these too. I've had sippy cups where they are leak proof but you have to suck really hard for anything to come out. Yes I do test these out once in awhile to make sure they are working.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R.

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves these and I love them
customer_reviews.text: Great for any parent that has a kid that loves to spill or throw things, my daughter can be a pickle at times and these things take a beating from being dropped and thrown around by me or the little. Throw them in the dishwasher to give a good cleaning after a couple of day of just rinsing out after every change of liquids. Nice thing is when the little is needing more to drink at once and she isn't being a butt, you can remove the valve for a better flow. Great quality and long use, I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dr Killanger

customer_reviews.title: Toddler approved!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a cup my 17 month old will use. So ya, I read that a kid should stop using a bottle by 18 months. My son didn’t use any sippy cup we gave him. I was almost resigned to having him just keep using the bottle when I thought I would try and get a top rated cup off Amazon. My jaw dropped that he actually used this cup the first time. I thought it would be a struggle. Thank you to the genius or geniuses who engineered this cup.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Best Sippy Cups
customer_reviews.text: We keep these handy for our 2 & 3 year old grandsons. They need a cup with a hard, solid lid. We've tried the softer spouts, but they always chew holes or they purposely squeeze the spout to leak water. Mainly because they are little jerks, but we were able to correct the issue with these cups. They are 99% leak proof and easy to use for our grandsons. They say dishwasher safe, but I honestly have never put them through ours so I can't really speak to it. Would recommend for the chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Deceived... Ordered red and blue....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered MY SON what I thought would be red and blue 100% leak proof sippy cups, but to my surprise when opening my package the cups are PINK AND PURPLE! irritated but it's just a cup so I digress. I gave one star because these cups are definitely not leak proof, my son left the cup upside down on the couch and the whole cup leaked out onto the COUCH. I WILL NEVER BUY AGAIN!! Buyers be warned BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!
customer_reviews.author: MRS.FOSKEY

customer_reviews.title: 100% Leak proof
customer_reviews.text: My little one chews through bottle nibbles like it’s no one’s business. We usually have to replace one every 2 weeks. We have been searching for a leak proof, hard spout milk bottle for a year now. This bottle is perfect! It’s so easy to clean and easy for her to hold. One downside is there is always a residual milk that cannot flow to the nibble. Just the way the top is designed. We have tried to remove the stopper but it does not solve the problem. Overall, it’s a good bottle!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use as a first sippy cup
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 1.5 year old and realized after receiving them that they are for younger little ones just transitioning to sippy cups due to the small holes in the spout. She really had to suck to get the milk out. We typically use the Nuk Gerber Graduate sippy cups, but I wasn't looking to pay $5+ at the time and this was a great deal. They are ok and serve their purpose. I ended up removing the valve for my 3 year old. I still keep it in for the 1.5 year old.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Good cups
customer_reviews.text: These are great little cups. The only problems I have with them are that if you don't get the lid on the track just right it will leak. More of a trial and error thing. Also I don't like that my boy has problems getting all of his drink out of the cup. Because of where the nozzle is on the inside, it doesn't go all the way to the side of the cup and isn't flat. Making it impossible to full drain the cup without opening it. Other than that it is a good cup and doesn't leak much.
customer_reviews.author: Katie McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Leak when travelling, but are fine for home use
customer_reviews.text: These cups are fine for around the house. Very minimal leaking. However, for some reason that I cannot for the life of me figure out, when I pack them in a bag when we are travelling, THEY LEAK EVERYWHERE! I barely made it though airport security before half of the milk was out of these cups and all over my bag. This is before we even got on the plane so I know it wasn't an air pressure issue. I've tried three different times hoping it was user error, but every time they leak. Again, they work perfectly for home use though.
customer_reviews.author: M. LeighTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: No spills!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these at 55% off and I'm super impressed with the quality for how cheap they are! Our 15-month-old throws them on the floor (carpeted) from his high chair and we've had no spills. He also throws them on the tile floor from standing level and no spills. Just, wow. We use one for milk and one for water at all times. Dishwasher safe (although, I handwash the sealing piece) and haven't noticed any issues with cleanliness. I need to order another pack so we have some extras on hand.
customer_reviews.author: themittenresale

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these cups for years with my youngest. He has asthma and EOE. Many nights be wakes up coughing and unable to swallow well. Usually we try a sip of cold water to see if that helps calm things down. He’s almost 7 years old now and he still uses one at night. They’re pretty great and we haven’t had any leaks. We only use them for bed time and with water. I don’t have a dishwasher so they’ve lasted getting hand washed every day.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing and affordable. No leaks at all, even when held upside down after drinking from it. The shape of the cup allows my daughter to hold them with one hand. They are also every easy to clean and the larger opening makes it mess free to use the ice machine dispenser on the refrigerator door! I will only buy this brand going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Best sippy cups!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried lots of different sippy cups on the search for ones that don’t leak and don’t have a piece that need to be replaced. My son chewed through all the ones that has the soft spouts, and all the others leaked. These solve both of those problems. I have ordered several more because these are the only ones we need! They are very durable and easy for my toddler to hold. The only downside is they don’t really fit in any cup holders, but the pros outweighed that for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jayhawk13

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t order again
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of these. My fault for not paying more attention to the dimensions but the bottom is too big to fit in a cup holder. They sweat so the sides get wet pretty quickly. Also don’t care for the mechanism inside the lid that can easily get dirty. Currently I’ll use these for water due to how large they are & so the lids don’t get a build up with milk or sugar from juice.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: The best toddler cups out there!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only cups I buy for my daughter anymore! We have at least 15! They never leak, they’re easy for her to hold, and they’re a good size. I recommend these to all the toddler moms I know
customer_reviews.author: Krysta Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, good quality, worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I love these cups. Sippy cups are another thing my daughter is constantly misplacing and these are so cheap that I don’t see it as a big deal to just buy more. The quality is still really there as well. They only leak a little (like liquid gets in between the stopper and the tip of the cup and that can spill out) so I’m super here for it. Plus they hold more the a lot of sippy cups which I hate doing frequent refills so that’s nice too. I do wish you could pick your colors.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: It took a min for my child to get use to the hard sippy. I haven't had a leak issue to date but we have not been using them for long and only at meal time. Sometimes it leaks when he is drinking but I feel it is more on how he is sucking it not the cup itself. When he drops or shall I say throws it on the ground I have not noticed any splatter like I have see with other cups. I will update if it changes.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Dungan

customer_reviews.title: Received Wrong Colors Twice
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is fine. But the low score is due to the poor lack of customer service. I ordered red and blue and received pink and purple. Another order was sent as a replacement, and I was not required to send back my incorrect order. Which I thought was great. However, I received pink and purple again. This time I would be required to send back the items in order to receive a refund which is a nuisance I didn't want to mess with for cups.
customer_reviews.author: L M

customer_reviews.title: Possible bad manufacturing batch?
customer_reviews.text: I am wondering if I received cups from a badly manufactured batch of these because I noticed complaints similar to mine in the reviews in the last couple of days. The lids have an arrow that should align with the "spill-proof" zone once it is screwed in to place. No matter how hard I tried (my husband, too), there was no way that the lids would screw on such that the arrow aligned with the spill-proof zone. The arrow was still nearly a full 180 degrees away from the zone. You would have had to break the plastic in order to try to make it happen. When filled with water, they leaked like crazy once inverted.
customer_reviews.author: mvaughn

customer_reviews.title: They work great for my toddler...
customer_reviews.text: But they are hard to clean in some spots of the cover portion. I can see this being a problem with grime and eventually potential mold issue if you can't get to the hard to reach areas by the hole. Maybe they should come up with a cleaning tool to aide the ease of cleaning these hard to reach areas. Otherwise, it works great and has for every toddler I've known using them over the last 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Caelan loroff

customer_reviews.title: They work great for my toddler...
customer_reviews.text: But they are hard to clean in some spots of the cover portion. I can see this being a problem with grime and eventually potential mold issue if you can't get to the hard to reach areas by the hole. Maybe they should come up with a cleaning tool to aide the ease of cleaning these hard to reach areas. Otherwise, it works great and has for every toddler I've known using them over the last 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish you could select color but it’s a great cup
customer_reviews.text: My seven year old is autistic and this is the only brand of sippy cup he’s willing to use. I wish they were a little cheaper. I also wish you could pick your colors because I always seem to get pink and purple. He doesn’t mind and it’s fine at home but I don’t like sending him to therapy with a pink cup. If you buy these it’s worth buying extra stoppers bc they get gross and wear out faster then the cup does
customer_reviews.author: Ayden Wright

customer_reviews.title: Not my pick
customer_reviews.text: Pros: easy to clean. Hard mouthpiece so kid can't stab it with utensils and ruin it. Made in USA Cons: it's impossible to empty the cup using the mouthpiece. It leaves about a third of an ounce in the cup. I hate wasting. Also the base is too wide to fit in the cosco high chair tray cupholder.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great look but poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: These could be designed a little bit easier to hold but they are somewhat easy to clean compared to others. I wouldn't suggest buying them though in the future, they will get me by for a little bit but my daughters hands have a hard time holding them and they if they are not closed exactly the way that they are supposed to they leak all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Brailey Stone

customer_reviews.title: Unk First essentials sippy cups
customer_reviews.text: I actually was so disappointed I ordered this for my son I ordered the blue and red cups & instead I received a pink & purple one so I just gave my daughter those’s colors. It was a waste due to the fact it was intended for my son & got girl cocked, but not a complete waste because I just gave it to my daughter even tho she didn’t need it but I wasn’t gonna throw it out. The workers have to be more aware of actually reading what the order is so they can fulfill it And satisfied a customer to what they’ve purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda A

customer_reviews.title: Favorite cups
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren love these cups. I wasn't sure if they'd work because there isn't a handle to grasp on to, but that actually worked to my favor. The cups with the handles, the kids tend to let hang down by their sides while they carry them and they drip liquid on the floor. This cup takes two toddler hands to hold and carry, so the kids carry them upright and nothing spills. They're holding up beautifully thru use and dishwasher cleanings. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That

customer_reviews.title: Leak proof but dislike the shape
customer_reviews.text: These are fine sippy cups. They are leak/spill proof as long as the valve is being used. The only thing I don’t like is that the bottom is so wide it doesn’t fit in any cup holder and it is often awkward to place on the high chair tray with a plate or bowl of food at the same time. So they work fine for non-meal times or non-travel times.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Engel

customer_reviews.title: Seriously leak-proof
customer_reviews.text: My kids figured out they could smush the soft spouts on other sippy cups and create super fun lakes. You can’t get water out of these without sucking. However, if they hit the floor enough times the valve inside will pop off and they will leak. Easy to fix. Also easy to clean, by hand or in dishwasher. Narrow enough in the middle for little hands to hold.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Wrong colors sent and hard to drink!
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the bad reviews first because when I ordered the “assorted colors” I expected to get unisex cups like the ones shown in the pictures (orange/blue, red/blue). Instead they sent me pink and purple. I figured my 2 year old son wouldn’t mind so we tried it anyway. He had the hardest time getting his milk out of the cup and it made him frustrated . I took out the lid stopper and the milk would spill out if he didn’t drink it perfectly or if he tipped the cup slightly. At least they were under $5 but I will be giving them away.
customer_reviews.author: SLHuber

customer_reviews.title: Viva la Gerber cups!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite cups EVER (so far at least). My child literally would hit her cups on objects (hard too) and throw her cups and these have had no issues at all with spills or dripping even. I was very surprised and thankful! I like that the cups are mismatched because to me it's fun and adds more color. These aren't too small for a toddler and aren't too heavy. Very glad it screws on because my little one can pop the lids off sippy cups that are pressed on. And I'm very glad there's no extra pieces inside that you have to wash out or that could get lost or destroyed in the dishwasher. Would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cup.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all different brands of cups from the expensive ones down to these. My daughter was using tomme tippie cups and they constantly leaked then I remembered using these for my older two kids. My daughter can chunk this across the room onto the floor and that valve is still going to be where it should be which means no leaks!! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: s.r.

customer_reviews.title: Best affordable baby sippy cups
customer_reviews.text: Great price, and I love the colors they sent (sea green and blue). These sippy cups work well and last a long time. The only downside is that they don't fit in cup holders, but that hasn't really been a problem for us. I've been using this brand/type for many years and they remain my favorite of all I've tried. Especially at this price ($4.50 for 2)!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Wastes milk
customer_reviews.text: I read someone else's review that there is a little left over milk that gets trapped in the lid, and i STILL stupidly bought these. I regret it. The amounts of milk add up. Also the suction on the no-spill valve is unecessarily strong. My one yr old still drank this milk but he seemed kinda annoyed. I bought the Phillips avent penguin sippy cups, it has a silicone valve and goes over the entire cross section to catch the last of the milk, and also has measure lines and fits on other avent bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Yukiko Mochizuki

customer_reviews.title: Second-stage sippy cups
customer_reviews.text: These are not the first sippy cups you would get for your baby as he transitions from the bottle or breast. It's better to start with something easier for him to grasp, preferably with handles. But, as the baby gets older, his hands get bigger, and he has more coordination, these are pretty close to perfect. They are also leak-proof so having them fall on their sides on the floor or diaper bag isn't a big problem. They come in sets of two and, unfortunately, you can't pick which two you want.
customer_reviews.author: tachi1Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Best sippy cups EVER.
customer_reviews.text: I have four little ones and have been through a TON of different sippy cups in my time. No matter how leak-proof they claim to be, they always seem to fail me... UNTIL THESE. These cups aren’t super fancy or cute, but they’re solid and built to last - and most importantly, they don’t leak! My toddler can toss his across the room and there won’t be a drop in sight. Good luck finding them in stores though... Amazon is your best bet.
customer_reviews.author: K.Z.

customer_reviews.title: Actually leak proof when your toddler chucks it!
customer_reviews.text: After trying half a dozen (or more) sippy cups, we saw these at a friend’s house and I WAS SOLD! I’d tried weighted straws, 360 cups, soft spout cups, etc. You name it and I’d tried it. These are the first ones that were TRULY leak proof (even when my toddler chucks them from his high chair). There is one tricky part in the lid to clean but other than that, they’re great. My only complaint is they don’t fit in the car seat cup holder.
customer_reviews.author: LFH

customer_reviews.title: Misleading color assortment.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this because even the assorted colors pictures were Unisex, but I received what is clearly “girl colors”. My son was very upset about it. I don’t understand why they would send a color combination that is not even pictured. This is extremely misleading to parents that need a certain color.
customer_reviews.author: P.B.L

customer_reviews.title: My favorites
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of the assorted packs. I got two pink and purple sets and one blue and green set. It was perfect for me because I have a little girl. I used these with my older children and they were my all time favorite. Easy clean up. If you see mold, that means you aren't cleaning the creases and crevices well. They are designed to where you should not have a problem using a scrub brush to clean the lids and a bottle nipple brush can get on the stopper part. Don't push the nipple brush through and move back and forth because you'll tear the little flaps. Then the cup will leak.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: I got a blue and red set with the assorted colors add-on!
customer_reviews.text: Woohoo! Tried the add-on twice and got pink and purple once and blue and red once. Awesome cups and the add on assorted colors option is fun and cheap - like spinning a wheel. I have a boy and a girl so any color is fine for us. The cups are sturdy and easy to drink from. They leak only if pushed down against a soft surface. My son often makes them "leak" by pressing them against the sofa. But not a lot and they don't leak much at all with normal throwing or dropping or shaking. And my kids are pretty rough with them.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Varghese

customer_reviews.title: Great Leakproof cups
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 and 3 year old and have purchased several of these cups. They are the only ones that have held up the longest through being leakproof. After about 9 months, one started to leak. But I really contribute that to the thousands of times it was thrown and/or dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Hangar Nut

customer_reviews.title: The world's BEST sippy cups!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best sippy cup in the world!!! Easy to clean I have 3 children and we are a firm believer in the nuk cup! They last 10xs longer than any other sippy cup we've tried!! I'm telling y'all I've spent hundreds of dollars on sippy cups ! Leak/spill proof you can throw them, my children has stepped on them and no leaks breaks or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but too wide
customer_reviews.text: Easy for my toddler to sip out of, leak-proof with valve in, durable when dropped, comes in nice color combos. However, there are a couple of "cons" to me: they're a little too wide for my toddler to hold it easily in one hand, and the base is also too wide for the car-seat's cup holder - Thus because of these 2 reasons, they're not my favorite "go to" cup and I probably wouldn't purchase more of them.
customer_reviews.author: DevotedMomWifeNurse

customer_reviews.title: Durable toddler cup
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter because she had outgrown some of her smaller cups. She has small hands and the thinner middle of the cup makes it easy for her to grip. It's dishwasher safe, plastic, and not easily broken. She has already dropped it o n the floor without any spills or cup breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t get exactly what was pictured but the cups work nice for my little one. I wouldn’t say they are 100% leak proof but much better than other cups I’ve tried. Easy for little hands to hold. Great price for two cups and I love that amazon sells the replacement valves also. I'd purchase again
customer_reviews.author: DZ85

customer_reviews.title: Love it! But doesn't fit in our child's cup holders
customer_reviews.text: We love everything about these bottles, colors, mechanism, shape, easy to clean, leak proof, except... it does not fit in any of our cup holders. Doesn't fit in the high chair cupholder (Graco brand), doesn't fit in the stroller cup holder (City Mini), not the car seat cupholder (Graco forever) and can be frustrating at times.
customer_reviews.author: Merlo

customer_reviews.title: WILL buy again
customer_reviews.text: Best sippy cups we have found to date. Literally the only ones we (or others in my family) have found that DO NOT LEAK. Even if my son shakes them around nothing comes out. If he throws it on the floor this might be a couple drops but nothing significant. Only downside is we forget to take out the little white restrictor on the inside before putting in the dishwasher sometimes. Definitely does not get clean in there unless that is removed for washing. Minor issue for us since we have a few of these in the rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Best Sippy, ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best sippy! My two year old shredded the silicone top sippies. And so many of those and other hard topped sippies are just not leak proof. Which sends my daughter into a complete meltdown. These are completely leak proof. And chew proof. They’re also very easy to clean. They’re, without question, our favorite sippies.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids of all ages
customer_reviews.text: 3 kids and 9 years later these are the only cups the have stood the test of time. They are easy to clean, inexpensive, and most importantly sturdy. They go right in the dishwasher and have no small pieces or nooks and crannies that need special tools to clean. If one gets lost or ruined it's not a huge expense to replace. They last forever. We have had them thrown, dropped, stepped on, and more with no lasting damage. They come in lots of color combinations so the kids can pick their cup and lid color for the day. The little insert plugs can easily be replaced if lost or ruined. These are a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: These are great, except one annoying flaw.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, except one annoying flaw. The way the valve is made does not allow for the last few sips of the beverage to come out. The only way to get to it is to open the top and remove the valve, then let your child drink the rest. Over time it wastes quite a bit of milk when I have to pour out a couple of sips when I clean the cups. Otherwise they are easy to use, are durable, haven't leaked, and are easy to hold. I would love if they came with some type of cap though.
customer_reviews.author: L. E.

customer_reviews.title: I need to own stock in these
customer_reviews.text: This cup is the best. My son loves it, i had to take him off a bottle when he was only 8 months because he kept popping the nipple. These have a hard spout and he was able to transition to it well. They do not leak. (However, as the stopper gets worn **6-8 months or more of use they tend to drip.) They are inexpensive enough to replace by then!
customer_reviews.author: Trish S.

customer_reviews.title: BEST SIPPY CUP!!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this 2 pack for my 19mos old. I have tried soooo many sippy cups. THIS one legit supersedes all of them! The ONLY one I've found that does NOT leak and is an easy grip for him. I do say if those white inserts are NOT in right or securely... they WILL leak. If the top is not on securely or not tight in the "lock zone" it WILL leak so make sure all is right and secure and you wont have an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Colors/do not fit in cup holders
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son and I was hoping to get the blue and orange set when I ordered the “assorted colors” set but ended up with the pink and purple set. No worries though bc my son loves purple. I’m just letting those of you ordering know that it is a possibility. Also these cups do not fit in my son’s cup holders on his graco car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean but not as easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 13.5 months and we're trying these out. She isn't having as easy a time holding these as she does the other cups we have. Also, be aware that although a Gerber product is advertised you will receive the newer Nuk product. Lining up the lid and cup in the seal zone is a bit of a pain and takes practice.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Love these Cups!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite type of sippy cups because they are super sturdy, they never leak, and they are easy to clean. My older son used these and now my younger one does too, and out of the endless types of cup designs we've gone through these have been a blessing. There's no weird grooves where milk can hide out and spoil. The lids are easy to get on; the threads line up nicely every time and my 4 year old is able to screw the lids back on himself. These are the only sippy cups I prefer to have and use.
customer_reviews.author: Sina M.

customer_reviews.title: Product is good but we received the wrong colors
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the Pink/Purple for our daughter but we received Blue/Mint Green. We kept them as our daughter likes them and they are easy to use. It would have been 5 stars if we received what we ordered. We will try to order the Pink/Purple again!
customer_reviews.author: Merrick Family

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great cups!! My 3 year old is autistic and we have struggled to find him a sippy cup that he cant chew the nipple off of, any cups with hard nipples he refused to drink from and soft nipples he chews through within a week. This is finally a hard spout cup he will use!!!! Easy to clean with just 3 parts, hasnt leaked at all and hes been throwing it around, affordable price, and he loves it! Highly recommend this cup! Will absolutely be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Amity

customer_reviews.title: Love these sippy cups
customer_reviews.text: I love these bottles! My kids can throw them around, drop them, or even just hold them upside down and they do. not. leak! They’re super easy to clean, too! These don’t mold nearly as fast and they are the easiest things ever to clean. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Durable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I love them and so does my 2 year old. He use to only take walmart brand soft nipple sippys but he started to bite holes in them. Read other reviews and heard these were the way to go. So happy we gave them a try. Easy to clean, easy for him to hold and drink from, leak proof/he cant tip it upside down and beat it on the floor to get milk out and most importantly, easy on the wallet.
customer_reviews.author: gary peschel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my little cousins and nieces. The color coordinated tops help me keep track of who’s cup is who’s. They also have a way to adjust the lid to prevent spillage. This is a big help when the one year old is on the move. They can be easily cleaned using the top rack of the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Hart Siburt

customer_reviews.title: Fairly leak proof and durable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. The spout is pretty leak proof and my daughter can't chew them to death (we lose many cups that way). My one complaint is that the surface is really smooth so it is hard to write her name on them for daycare. The sharpie just wipes right off.
customer_reviews.author: Micah-Shea Crenshaw McKibben

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Meets all the criteria: easy to clean, doesn’t leak (great water bottle for toddler’s bed), holds a lot of water. Total bonus that these are made in the USA and inexpensive to boot! We’ve tried a lot of different types of water bottles and sippy cups for our toddlers but these are now our favorite.
customer_reviews.author: SBR

customer_reviews.title: Received girl colors, not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have boys and and received girls colors, not as advertised and very misleading. I was supposed to get blue and red. 👎
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: 99% Leakproof
customer_reviews.text: When dropped from a high chair it will leak some. More leakproof than most cups available. Great in a bag as it doesn’t leak. Too wide to fit in cup holders. Odd shape for hand washing with a brush but still doable and seems to clean just fine in our dishwasher
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs

customer_reviews.title: Theses are the best...
customer_reviews.text: Best sippy cups ever! They last for years and this size holds enough milk to keep you from running to the frig as often. They wash up easily and are easy for a toddler to hold. They are well made and can take being dropped and abused. Asking as you get the plug in properly they won't leak. I'd never get another brand. Idk what we would have done without them. All the other brands wore out but these last and last...
customer_reviews.author: C. WallaceTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Cat Puzzle Feeder
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate features like "leak proof" because I use these as puzzle feeders for my cats. For that purpose, they are fantastic. The overall shape combined with the ridges means that the cats really do have to puzzle through how to get their treats (dry food) out of the cup. If I were up for the mess, the sturdiness of these cups would also allow me to put wet food in there.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has loved these zippy cups because all of the soft spout ones she bites right through them and these last longer for her now that she’s older. Only down side is to wash it you have to make sure to wash the spout good and that it does not have any residue stuck in it. Other than that we have used these for months now.
customer_reviews.author: Kiara Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: I love these sippy cups
customer_reviews.text: I love these sippy cups. They are my favorite toddler cup as they are easy to clean, easy to grip, and are a good size. There are 2 things however that I wish Gerber would improve: 1. They do not fit in standard cup holders- this is unfortunate while in her car seat, stroller, etc. 2. The "spill proof" insert can be broken quite easily while cleaning. I usually use my pinky finger with dish soap to clean the "seal" part really good because using things like the bottle brush nipple brush breaks them really easily. You can purchase replacement inserts from Amazon though!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great cups - way too big for early toddler hands
customer_reviews.text: My son (18 months - about average for his age) likes these cups - the colors and the shape. They don't leak, and they wash well. That said, when close to full, he can't hold it with one hand at all, and it doesn't fit in the holder of his highchair or car seat. The shape is good, but the sizing is just off.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I love these sippy cups they're durable and spill proof. The only thing I wasn't happy with is that I ordered the red and blue cup for my son and instead I received a pink and purple one. Other than that no biggie . .still works
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Best Cup Ever
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2 goung on 3. I have tried about 5 different cups on him. Every single one he has chewed the straw on the cups and made them to where he can pour out his drink. This cup is the best cup out there. He can not bite the spout where the liquids come put of. It is 100% leak proof. Easy for him to drink out of. I highly recommend tjis cup to anyone who is needing a leak proof cup for their child. Took him about 3 times using it to figure it out. Highly Highly Highly recommend this cup.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany M Lawlis

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sippy cups I have used so far. They can still drip but it is rare. They are very easy to clean. Overall I am very happy with them! Update: One of the silicone parts on the valve popped out and the sippy cup was leaking like crazy. I called Gerber and I can honestly say they have GREAT customer service. I explained my issue and they are sending me out replacement parts. These have truly been the best sippy cups we have used and I highly recommend them. It is a bonus that the company is so responsive! Very satisfied customer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea N

product_meta.title: NUK First Essentials Fun Grips Hard Spout, Assorted Colors, 10oz 2pk
product_meta.description:
Size:2-Pack| Color:AssortedThe Gerber Graduates Fun Grips Hard Spout Cup continues your baby's path toward independent drinking. Its bite-resistant spout is designed to help your toddler drink independently. The cup features Seal Zone technology, a unique closing system that ensures its 100% leak-proof, spill-proof, and break-proof, guaranteed. The hourglass shape also prevents tipping. Plus, you never have to worry about cup mix-ups with the personalization area for your little one’s name! Easy to clean and dishwasher safe, this cup is BPA-free, made in the USA and designed for children 12-months and older. The cup comes in a pack of (2) with assorted colors. All Gerber Graduates cups help support healthy motor skill development to foster happy, healthy kids every sip of the way! The NUK family of brands designs safe and fun products that encourage your baby's development. NUK is committed to nurturing your children's healthy transitions from birth to toddler and has worked for over 50 years to design high quality, innovative products that are scientifically proven to support safe and healthy development.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Graduates fun grips color spill proof cup changes color when filled with cold liquid; color reverses with warmth of hand.
feature_bullets: Note: This is an assorted product; color and print advertised are subjected to vary.
Bite resistant spout helps toddler drink independently
Seal zone technology – 100% leak-proof, spill-proof, break-proof, guaranteed
Hourglass shape prevents tipping; Dishwasher-safe, BPA-free; Comes in a pack of (2)

specifications.Safety warning:
Allowing your child to spend prolonged periods of time drinking liquids, other than water, from a cup may cause early childhood tooth decay.
Caution: Always supervise children when eating/drinking. To avoid injury, do not allow a child to walk or run with a cup. Do not microwave.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,966 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
